articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Factory under KPA Navy Unit
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Factory under KPA Navy Unit
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, inspected a factory under KPA Navy Unit 597.
					 After receiving a salute, he went round a room devoted to the history of the factory, conducted by its leading officials.
					
					 Going round historical relics and data associated with the undying leadership feats of President Kim Il Sung, he looked back with deep emotion on those unforgettable historical days.
					
					 The factory could cover the path of shining victory thanks to his meticulous guidance and loving care, Kim Jong Il said, calling on the workers of the factory to always keep deep in their mind the loving care shown by the President.
					
					 He watched information about workers and technicians who creditably fulfilled their revolutionary duties while working at the factory for a long time and merited persons in the Songun era who did many good things for society and the collective. He highly appreciated their patriotism.
					
					 He then went round several places of the factory, learning in detail about the technological equipment and production.
					
					 Impregnable is the homeland as there is the inexhaustible strength of the army and people of the DPRK who are working hard to defend and glorify the most advantageous socialist system, he said.
					
					 He advanced important tasks to serve as guidelines in the management and operation of the factory.
					
					 He expressed the expectation and conviction that the workers of the factory would as ever remain loyal to the Songun leadership of the WPK. He had a photo session with the labor innovators of the factory.
					
					 Accompanying him were Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, KPA Generals Jong Myong Do, Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su and KPA Col. General O Chol San.

articles.title: Minister of People's Security Dismissed
articles.content:
Minister of People's Security Dismissed
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- Ju Sang Song, minister of People's Security of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, was dismissed from his post due to illness.
					 The NDC of the DPRK released a decision on it on Wednesday.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for Malaysia and Laos
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Malaysia and Laos 
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Information Committee headed by its Vice-Chairman Jong Yong Chol left here on Wednesday to visit Malaysia and Laos.

articles.title: New DPRK Ambassador to Pakistan Appointed
articles.content:
New DPRK Ambassador to Pakistan Appointed
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- Ro Kyong Chol was appointed as DPRK ambassador to Pakistan, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.

articles.title: Tree-planting at Russian Embassy
articles.content:
Tree-planting at Russian Embassy
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- A tree-planting was held at the Russian embassy here on Wednesday on the occasion of the 62nd anniversary of the conclusion of an agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and Russia.
					 Present there were Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Valery Sukhinin and staff members of his embassy, Kim Song Hak, vice-minister of Land and Environmental Conservation, and officials concerned.
					
					 Speeches were made.
					
					 Speakers said that the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation laid a legal foundation for developing exchanges and cooperation between the two countries. They also expressed their will to strengthen the cooperation in various fields based on it in the future, too.
					
					 After planting trees the participants talked about developing the bilateral friendship.

articles.title: 2.16 Science and Technology Prize Awarded
articles.content:
February 16 Science and Technology Prize Awarded
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- Certificates and medals of the February 16 science and technology prize were awarded to scientists, technicians and officials in different units. They include the North Phyongan Provincial Tideland Reclamation Complex, University of Science and the Taedonggang Tile Factory. 
					 They made contribution to developing embankment project method at the Taegyedo tideland and plasma technology by laser and putting on a modern basis the production process of building materials relying on locally available raw materials. 
					
					 Certificates of scientific and technological innovation prize were awarded to scientists, technicians and officials of Pyongyang College of Medicine under Kim Il Sung University and the Kujang Area Coal Mining Complex.  
					
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Wednesday.

articles.title: Top Prize of WIPO Awarded to Inventions of DPRK
articles.content:
Top Prize of WIPO Awarded to Inventions
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The World Intellectual Property Organization decided to award its top inventor prizes to new inventions of the DPRK. 
					 They are "Manufacturing technique of composites for keeping freshness of the immortal flower Kimjongilia", "Establishment of new iron-making system" and "Construction method of concrete dam by prefabricated structural elements". They won gold medals at the 11th National Invention and New Technology Exhibition that was held in the DPRK last year. 
					
					 The organization appreciates new propositions universally recognized to be significant and valuable for economic growth and scientific and technical development and their inventors. 
					
					 The WIPO top prizes awarded to the DPRK this time are another pride of its scientific world.

articles.title: Tourists Likely to Increase
articles.content:
Tourists Likely to Increase
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The number of tourists is likely to increase in the DPRK this year, said an official of the State General Bureau of Tourism.
					 Hong In Chol, a department director of the bureau, told KCNA that new programs have been prepared for foreign tourists.
					
					 Pyongyang will host a lot of cultural and sports events this year, he said, adding:
					
					 The April Spring Friendship Art Festival will draw artistes from many countries.
					
					 A large-scale magic performance, the first of its kind in the country, is also scheduled to start at May Day Stadium in Pyongyang in the same month.
					
					 Many local and foreign people have booked tickets for the spectacle.
					
					 The grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" will be given this year, too.
					
					 "Arirang" was listed as the world's masterpiece in the Guinness World Records book.
					
					 The 17th World Taekwon-Do Championships will take place in Pyongyang in September.
					
					 Besides, IAAF-the 24th Mangyongdae Prize Marathon and other international and national tournaments will be held this year.
					
					 The State General Bureau of Tourism, the International Travel Company and other travel companies of the DPRK are working on preparations for accepting foreign tourists.

articles.title: Korean Fancy Fliers
articles.content:
Korean Fancy Fliers
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- Korean acrobatic feat "Fliers" won the top prize at the 19th Massy International Circus Festival held in January.
					 The fliers performed at least ten stunts, including flying 20 meters diagonally from a swing and surmounting obstacles.
					
					 Ri Ji Song and Choe Chol, main players in the feat, made the longest flights in the world.
					
					 They studied at Pyongyang Acrobatic School at the same time and joined the Pyongyang Circus.
					
					 They have also performed in the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" given at May Day Stadium every year.

articles.title: Improved Taedonggang Beer
articles.content:
Improved Taedonggang Beer
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The Taedonggang Beer Factory in Pyongyang has produced new varieties of beer.
					 The new varieties brewed with rice, mixed with malt, are enjoying popularity among local people.
					
					 The factory, which obtained the ISO 9001 for the first time in the local foodstuff sector, has applied a foodstuff-safety management system to the production processes and improved the taste and quality of beer by increasing the degree of fermentation.
					
					 The Taedonggang beer won the special prize at the National Exhibition of Successes in Quality Control held in August Juche 98 (2009) and took the top place at the National Beer Show in October that year.
					
					 The beer has many efficacious elements including vitamins and mineral matters but less sugar content, giving a good effect on diabetes and obesity.
					
					 The beer made of rice is not too strong but clear and frothy.
					
					 The beer is also popular among foreign tourists.

articles.title: Gene-Transferred Chrysanthemum Bred
articles.content:
Gene-Transferred Chrysanthemum Bred
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Floricultural Institute of the DPRK has succeeded in breeding perpetual chrysanthemum No. 1 through a gene transfer.
					 The newly-bred plant is large in blossom, rapid in growth rate and easy to bloom before or after April 15.
					
					 It is two or three times higher than original chrysanthemum in resistance to drought. It is also high in rate of rooting. 
					
					 The ornamental plant does not make pollen and vegetatively reproduces itself, giving no harmful effect on human body and environment.

articles.title: Korea Boasts of Time-Honored Tea Culture
articles.content:
Korea Boasts of Time-Honored Tea Culture
Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- Unjong Tea enjoys a great popularity in Pyongyang.
					The tea plant is cultivated in Kangryong County, South Hwanghae Province.
					
					The Korean people have liked to drink tea from olden times.
					
					Tea is diverse in its kind, with grain teas having a long history.
					
					Sungnyung (scorched-rice tea) is prepared easily after boiling rice. The tasty and nutritive tea is taken after meal. The grain teas also include five-grain (rice, millet, beans, wheat and barnyard millet) tea and barley tea.
					
					There are also other teas made with roots, leaves and fruits. Insam (ginseng) Tea and Kasiogalphi (Eleutherococcus senticosus) Tea are very good for health, while Sollip (pine-leaf) Tea reduces cholesterol in blood.

articles.title: Hoeryong Koryo Medicine Factory
articles.content:
Hoeryong Koryo Medicine Factory
						
Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The Hoeryong Koryo Medicine Factory situated in North Hamgyong Province manufactures many kinds of highly efficacious Koryo medicines through a germ-free and dust-free production processes.
					The medicines are made with medical plants rich in the area.
					
					The two-storied building has experimental, pulverizing, drying and other facilities.
					
					All the processes ranging from chopping, cleaning, drying and pulverizing to packing are streamlined to produce large quantities of quality medicines. 
					
					In particular, the concentrator not only keeps the natural ingredients of the medicinal herbs undamaged, but also ensures a continuous incrassation.

articles.title: US Dangerous Military Provocation Flayed--Minju Joson
articles.content:
US Dangerous Military Provocation Flayed--Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The United States is mulling deploying one E-737 in south Korea by July this year and three more by 2012 for the round-the-clock monitoring of the sky above the Korean Peninsula. 
					 Minju Joson Wednesday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 Such action is an extremely dangerous military provocation to ignite another war on the peninsula.
					
					 Serious is that the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces are becoming all the more undisguised in their attempt at a war against the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. openly asserted that the purpose of the joint military exercises is to divest the DPRK of its "nuclear weapons and WMDs" and cope with "contingency". This only disclosed the aggressive and belligerent nature of the U.S. and the south Korean joint military exercises. 
					
					 The U.S. is talking about "dialogue", but in actuality, it set it as its unique DPRK strategy to stifle it by force of arms.
					
					 It is inciting war hysteria on the peninsula. Lurking behind this is its sinister intention to establish military domination over Northeast Asia with the peninsula as a base. This is its invariable strategy.
					
					 The situation in Northeast Asia is rendered extremely tense owing to the reckless military provocation by the U.S. to establish its military domination over the peninsula and Northeast Asia.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to stop at once reckless saber-rattling which dampens the unanimous desire of mankind for lasting peace on the peninsula.

articles.title: Dialogue and War Cannot Go Together--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Dialogue and War Cannot Go Together--Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities are talking about "dialogue" on the one hand and holding war exercises on the other hand, threatening the dialogue partner. Dialogue and war exercises cannot go together. Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article. 
					 Dialogue is the best way of defusing the north-south confrontation and tension and peacefully solving the issue of reunification of the country, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The south Korean warmongers launched the adventurous joint military exercises with outside forces under the simulated conditions of a war against the DPRK. They signify a challenge to the efforts of the peace-loving DPRK for dialogue. They not only spoiled the atmosphere of dialogue and increased the danger of a new war on the Korean Peninsula but dashed the hope of Koreans at home and abroad for detente and peace on the peninsula and improved north-south relations. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities' war exercises will only reveal their scheme to stifle the DPRK by force of arms. 
					
					 If they truly want north-south dialogue and peace on the peninsula, they should not just pay lip-service to "dialogue" but stop at once the war exercises against the DPRK.

articles.title: Friendship and Solidarity, Avowed Ideas of DPRK's Foreign Policy
articles.content:
Friendship and Solidarity, Avowed Ideas of DPRK's Foreign Policy
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- To boost friendship and solidarity with all the countries and peoples aspiring after independence is one of the steadfast principles of the DPRK's foreign policy. Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The changes in international relations at present require countries to boost friendly relations.
					
					 Only when all the countries and peoples aspiring after independence support and cooperate with each other and boost genuine international friendship can they shatter the imperialist aggression forces' war policy and moves for domination, defend peace and achieve national prosperity and development.
					
					 When all the countries give support and achieve solidarity on the principle of independence, equality, mutual respect and non-interference in others' internal affairs, friendly relations among countries can become genuine and solid ones.
					
					 Big-power chauvinists tend to put down and dominate others in relations among countries and nations while sycophants fawn on big and developed countries, while reading their faces, not relying on one's own strength. Such actions will cause inequality and discord among countries and nations, making it difficult to forge genuine friendly relations.
					
					 The DPRK is maintaining the stand to establish and normalize diplomatic relations even with those countries that had had inglorious relations with it, not asking the past, if they respect its sovereignty. Several countries have established diplomatic relations with the DPRK in recent years alone.
					
					 It is the steadfast stand of the DPRK to establish and develop friendly, cooperative and good-neighborly relations with all the countries in the world which respect its sovereignty and are friendly toward it and thus shatter the war policy of the imperialist aggression forces and their moves for domination and make positive contributions to defending peace and realizing global independence.

articles.title: Probe into Truth behind Corruption and Irregularities Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Probe into Truth behind Corruption and Irregularities Urged in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed that the clan of the chief executive of south Korea faked up a "letter case" to conceal the truth about the "BBK stock price case", sparking public furor, said the March 11th issue of the south Korean Segye Ilbo.
					 According to it, when the chief executive was elected as "presidential" candidate, Kim Kyong Jun disclosed the "BBK stock price case."
					
					 In order to cover up the case, the conservative ruling forces including the "Grand National Party" totally denied it, saying that it is a "premeditated plot to give impact on the presidential election". Timed to coincide with this, his colleague opened to the public a letter confirming the fact.
					
					 The prosecution charged Kim Kyong Jun with fraudulence, not confirming the truth about the letter, and declared others related to the case not suspicious.
					
					 The paper said that Sin Myong, younger brother of Sin Kyong Hwa, the original writer of the letter, testified to the fact: "The letter which was known to have been sent by my elder brother was written by me" and "the family of MB (Lee Myung Bak) masterminded the case."
					
					 If the prosecution concealed the case in which the family of the "presidential" candidate was involved, it is a grave neglect of duty, it said. 
					
					 The truth should be probed though belatedly, it urged.

articles.title: 15,000th Issue of Choson Sinbo Marked
articles.content:
15,000th Issue of Choson Sinbo Marked
Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- Chief Editor of the Choson Sinbo Company Choe Kwan Ik made public an article on the occasion of the 15,000th issue of Choson Sinbo on Monday. Choson Sinbo is an organ of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					 The article says:
					
					 Choson Sinbo speaks for the will and rights of overseas Koreans.
					
					 For the 65 odd years since its foundation the paper published 15 000 issues.
					
					 The brilliant history of the paper would be unthinkable without the wise leadership and benevolence of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The credit for the development of the paper also goes to the valuable efforts made by the officials of Chongryon and compatriots who have carried forward the patriotic stand overcoming all sorts of trials.
					
					 The paper has discharged its noble mission as a witness of the history, a faithful companion of Koreans in Japan and their mouthpiece.
					
					 The officials of Chongryon and compatriots will work with redoubled efforts to usher in a heyday of the organization and the community of Koreans in Japan, keeping pace with the people in the homeland who are making a dynamic general advance to build a thriving nation.

articles.title: Joint Military Exercises Rebuffed by Ecuadorian Organization
articles.content:
Joint Military Exercises Rebuffed by Ecuadorian Organization
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People released a statement on Mar. 9 denouncing the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises. It urged the UN, the U.S., Japan and the south Korean authorities to halt the military exercises, not interfere in the internal affairs of other countries and denuclearize the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world.
					 The joint military exercises will escalate the tension and danger of war in the Korean Peninsula and bring irrevocable consequences to the world, it noted.
					
					 All the forces desirous of peace demand the south Korean authorities stop at once the provocative military exercises and opt for peace of the peninsula and the independent reunification of Korea, it stressed.
					
					 It also demanded the U.S. withdraw its forces from south Korea at once and replace the Armistice Agreement signed in 1953 with a peace treaty.

articles.title: National Seminar on Juche Idea, Songun Idea Held in Nepal
articles.content:
National Seminar on Juche Idea, Songun Idea Held in Nepal
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- A national seminar on the Juche idea, Songun idea took place in Kathmandu, Nepal on March 9.
					Displayed in the venue of the seminar were photos showing the feats of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A congratulatory speech made by the director of the administration of the Kathmandu City Office was followed by speeches of other personages. 
					
					 The speakers said that the history of the Korean revolution is the history of the Juche idea and the Songun politics. The DPRK turned into an invincible socialist power thanks to the Songun politics by Kim Jong Il, they added.
					
					 His Songun politics convinced us of his greatness and wise leadership, they said, expressing their determination to further strengthen the activities to study and disseminate the Juche idea and the Songun idea in the future.
					
					 The participants positively responded to the proposal of followers of the Juche idea of Bangladesh to hold a grand world meeting on the Juche idea in the DPRK on the occasion of the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: China Makes Efforts to Eradicate Aftermath of Earthquake
articles.content:
China Makes Efforts to Eradicate Aftermath of Earthquake
						
Beijing, March 14 (KCNA) -- China is making efforts to eradicate the aftermath of earthquake that hit Yingjiang County, Yunnan Province.
					 The party and the government of China have taken positive steps to bring the living of the people in the afflicted areas to normal as early as possible and put the production in various fields going.
					
					 In the wake of earthquake General Secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party of China Hu Jintao and Premier Wen Jiabao instructed officials to carry out rescue operations with top priority given to the safety of the people in the afflicted areas. 
					
					 The Organizational Department of the C.C., the CPC released a notice calling on party organizations at all level, party members and cadres in the quake-hit areas to positively conduct the rescue operations in the spirit of the important instructions from the C.C., the CPC. 
					
					 All sectors and units are sending tents, medicines and other relief materials to the quake-stricken areas.
					
					 As of March 14, 8,913 tents, quilts, padded clothes, disinfectants and other relief materials reached those areas. Many medical workers are conducting service activities in relevant areas.
					
					More than 6,100 soldiers of the Chinese People's Liberation Army and the Chinese People's Armed Police Force, members of the militia and reserve units are taking the lead in the rescue operations with all efforts.
					
					 Thanks to their efforts, transport, communications, network of electricity and other basic facilities are being recovered.
					
					 The work to eradicate the damage of earthquake is going on.

articles.title: Obligatory Tree-planting Activities Brisk in China
articles.content:
Obligatory Tree-planting Activities Brisk in China
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- All-people obligatory tree-planting activities are brisk in China.
					 58. 896 billion trees of various species were planted across the country till the end of last year since the National People's Congress took a measure to conduct the activities in 1981.
					
					 A total of 12.73 billion people of various circles participated in the activities in this period.

articles.title: Iran Accuses UNSC of Taking Discriminatory Decisions
articles.content:
Iran Accuses UNSC of Taking Discriminatory Decisions 
 Tehran, March 14 (KCNA) -- The UN Security Council was not credible anymore because it took discriminatory decisions on Iran's nuclear program under the pressure of big powers, Iranian president's top advisor Mojtaba Samareh-Hashemi said when interviewed by IRNA recently. 
					 He once again reiterated that Iran would not retreat from its peaceful nuclear activities.

articles.title: Reinforcing Major Role of Iranian Unity Press Called for
articles.content:
Reinforcing Major Role of Iranian Unity Press Called for
 Tehran, March 14 (KCNA) -- Iranian minister of Culture and Islamic Guidance recently urged the mass media to disseminate precise and accurate information.
					 He said that people will be made disappointed should the media do not play its role as it should, adding that the media have very important role in strengthening national unity and cohesiveness.
					
					 It is a responsibility of the media to widely disseminate the just policies of the government as well as correct news and information.

articles.title: Afghan President Demands End of NATO Operations
articles.content:
Afghan President Demands End of NATO Operations
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- President of Afghanistan Hamid Karzai requested NATO high-command to end military operations in the country because of the daily increase in civilian deaths.
					 In a speech where NATO was accused of killing dozens of civilians, Karzai said that the Afghan people are dismayed because of the unfair victims of the armed conflict.

articles.title: Civilian Deaths Record High in Afghanistan Last Year
articles.content:
Civilian Deaths Record High in Afghanistan Last Year
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The UN group for aiding Afghanistan quoted a survey on March 9 as saying that 2,777 civilians were killed in Afghanistan last year due to a war.
					 This number is at a record level.

articles.title: Cuba Denounces US Seizure of Health Funds
articles.content:
Cuba Denounces US Seizure of Health Funds
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- As part of its blockade of Cuba, the United States seized UN aid funds allocated to Cuba by the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria for the first quarter of 2011, Cuba charged. 
					 The seizure of funds is an illegal action that seriously obstructs the international cooperation provided by the UN system, the deputy minister of foreign trade and investment said on Friday.
					
					 This action adds to a long list of examples of extraterritorial application of blockade imposed by the United States on Cuba for more than 50 years, he said. This will affect the implementation and continuation of social projects, he added.

articles.title: Three US Drone Attacks Kill 12 in Pakistan
articles.content:
Three US Drone Attacks Kill 12 in Pakistan
Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- At least 12 people were killed in three U.S. drone strikes launched Friday in Pakistan's northwest tribal area of North Waziristan.
					Pakistan opposes the U.S. strikes inside the country's tribal regions. The U.S. forces present in Afghanistan continues killing Pakistanis under the signboard of combating "terrorism."

articles.title: UN Official Concerned about Food Price Rise
articles.content:
UN Official Concerned about Food Price Rise 
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- A UN special rapporteur for food issue on Mar. 8 expressed concern about worldwide food price rise.
					 The rapporteur said that the world is facing the same serious food crisis as in 2008 amid the rise of food prices for eight months on end, adding that this is attributable not only to the natural disasters but to speculation in the financial field.

articles.title: Palestinian Leadership Condemns Israeli Approvals for Building Settlements
articles.content:
Palestinian Leadership Condemns Israeli Approvals for Building Settlements
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The Palestinian leadership on Sunday condemned Israel's approvals to build hundreds of houses for settlers in the West Bank.
					 "We totally and strongly condemn and reject the Israeli decision," said Saeb Erekat, a member of the Palestine Liberation Organization's executive committee. 
					
					 An Israeli ministerial committee approved the construction late Saturday. 
					
					 "Achieving peace and stability for all requires ending the Israeli occupation," Erekat said.
					
					 Erekat said the Palestinians are holding high-level contacts with the Quartet of Middle East peace mediators, asking them to stop the recent Israeli approvals.

articles.title: Belarus Not to Devalue Its Currency on IMF Recommendation--National Bank
articles.content:
Belarus Not to Devalue Its Currency on IMF Recommendation--National Bank
						
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- National Bank of Belarus is not going to follow the IMF recommendation to devalue the national currency, said the press secretary of the bank on March 12.
					 "Once the National Bank followed the IMF recommendation to conduct devaluation and made sure that the move did not make any positive effect on the balance-of-payments," he said.
					
					 He added that the devaluation had several negative consequences.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige fabrica de Unidad 597 de Fuerzas Navales del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige fabrica de Unidad 597 de Fuerzas Navales del EPC
Pyongyang, 16 de marzo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, inspecciono la fabrica subordinada a la Unidad 597 de las Fuerzas Navales del EPC.
					Tras recibir el parte de recepcion, recorrio la sala de presentacion del historial guiado por los funcionarios directivos de la fabrica.
					
					Viendo los objetos y datos que reflejan las inmortales hazanas de direccion del Presidente    Kim Il Sung, evoco con emocion los inolvidables dias historicos.
					
					Bajo la minuciosa direccion y atencion del Presidente, la fabrica pudo recorrer la senda de victorias orgullosas, senalo y subrayo que la clase obrera de la fabrica debe guardar eternamente en el corazon inmensas benevolencias del Presidente.
					
					Al ver los datos sobre la buena conducta de los obreros y tecnicos, que cumplieron lealmente su tarea revolucionaria trabajando largo tiempo en la fabrica, y de los benemeritos de la epoca del Songun que hicieron muchos trabajos utiles para la sociedad y el colectivo, evaluo altamente el patriotismo de ellos. 
					
					El Dirigente se entero en detalles del estado de equipos tecnicos y produccion recorriendo varios puntos.
					
					  Destaco que nuestra patria es un bastion inexpugnable gracias a las fuerzas inagotables del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea que luchan abnegadamente por defender y hacer brillar nuestro regimen socialista mas ventajoso.
					
					  Presento las tareas que serviran de guia en la administracion de la fabrica.
					
					  Expresando la esperanza y conviccion de que los obreros de aqui apoyaran fielmente tambien en el futuro la direccion del Songun del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, se fotografio con los innovadores laborales.
					
					  Acompanaron al Dirigente en esta ocasion el vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, Kim Jong Un, el miembro suplente del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Jang Song Thaek, los generales de ejercito del EPC Jong Myong Do, Hyon Chol Hae y Ri Myong Su, y el coronel general O Chol San.

articles.title: Destituido Ju Sang Song
articles.content:
Destituido Ju Sang Song
Pyongyang, 16 de marzo (ATCC) -- Ha sido destituido por la enfermedad el ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ju Sang Song.
					Quedo publicada el dia 16 la resolucion correspondiente del CDN de la RPDC.

articles.title: Se preve este ano el incremento de turistas a Corea
articles.content:
Se preve este ano el incremento de turistas a Corea
Pyongyang, 16 de marzo (ATCC) -- El director de seccion de la Direccion Nacional de Turismo, Hong In Chol (56 anos de edad), dijo a la ATCC que "vendran este ano mucho mas turistas extranjeros que el ano pasado" y subrayo que se elaboran para ellos nuevos programas de permanencia y visita.
					Se efectuaran este ano en esta capital numerosas actividades culturales y deportivas.
					
					En abril, se realizara el Festival Artistico de Amistad Abril en Primavera en que participan los artistas de numerosos paises.
					
					En el mismo mes, tendra lugar en el capitalino Estadio Primero de Mayo la gran funcion de magia creada por primera vez en Corea. 
					
					En la ocasion apareceran los objetos y animales de gran tamano y se presentaran varias piezas fantasticas.
					
					Ahora, un gran numero de nacionales y extranjeros estan reservando la entrada.
					
					Ademas, tendra lugar solemnemente la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang", obra maestra de talla mundial que fue registrada en el libro de record Guinness.
					
					En septiembre, esta programado el 17o Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-Do.
					
					Ademas, tendran lugar el 24o Torneo Internacional de Maraton por el Premio Mangyongdae como evento concurrente de la Asociacion Internacional de Federaciones Atleticas y otras citas deportivas nacionales e internacionales.
					
					La Direccion Nacional de Turismo, la Agencia de Turismo Internacional de Corea y otros organos relacionados impulsan los preparativos para facilitar las comodidades a los extranjeros que participen en dichas actividades.

articles.title: Son incompatibles el dialogo y la guerra, reitera Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Son incompatibles el dialogo y la guerra, reitera Rodong Sinmun 
Pyongyang, 16 de marzo (ATCC) --  El diario Rodong Sinmun inserto en su edicion de este miercoles un articulo individual destacando que son incompatibles el dialogo y los ejercicios belicos. 
					Las autoridades surcoreanas expresan por una parte la voluntad de "dialogar" y por la otra, desarrollan los ejercicios de guerra amenazando a su interlocutor, comienza el articulo y prosigue:
					
					El dialogo es el mejor remedio para eliminar la confrontacion y la tension entre ambas partes coreanas y resolver por via pacifica el problema de reunificacion del pais. 
					
					Los belicistas surcoreanos libraron los aventureros simulacros conjuntos contra la RPDC en contubernio con las fuerzas extranjeras y en desafio a los esfuerzos pacifistas de la RPDC por el dialogo, debido a lo cual se ha roto el ambiente de dialogo y se agranda el peligro de nueva guerra en la Peninsula Coreana. Al mismo tiempo, se desvanece la esperanza de los nacionales y extranjeros depositada en el alivio de tension y paz de la Peninsula Coreana y en la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas. 
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas reclaman mucho el "dialogo" librando a las espaldas los ejercicios belicos contra la RPDC. Este hecho pone a flote su intencion belicosa de atacar con armas a la RPDC. 
					
					Si ellas desean de veras el dialogo con la parte Norte y la paz de la Peninsula Coreana, no deben hablar en vacio de las "conversaciones" sino parar ahora mismo las contraproducentes maniobras de guerra contra el Norte.

articles.title: Explosion sucesiva de reactores crea estado de emergencia en Japon
articles.content:
Explosion sucesiva de reactores crea estado de emergencia en Japon
Pyongyang, 16 de marzo (ATCC) -- Se amplian en Japon las perdidas del gran terremoto ocurrido el dia 11.
					Segun la cadena NHK, hasta las 09:30 del dia 15, el numero de difuntos y desaparecidos fue 2 mil 476 y mas de 17 mil, respectivamente.
					
					En las costas de la peninsula Oshika del departamento de Miyagi fueron descubiertos casi mil cadaveres.
					
					El numero de refugiados alcanza 550 mil y en zonas damnificadas faltan cada vez mas el agua potable, alimentos, gasolina, etc.
					
					Se reportaron hasta las 9 am del dia 14 194 replicas de mas de 5 grados en escala abierta de Richter.
					
					Debido a los terremotos continuos, explotan uno tras otro los reactores de centrales nucleares.
					
					El dia 14, exploto el reactor no.3 de la Central Fukushima y al dia siguiente, lo hizo el reactor no.2.
					
					De acuerdo con la compania Tokio Electric Power (TEPCO), en la noche del dia 14, se agotaron casi las aguas refrigerantes del reactor no.2 y la barrilla de casi 4 metros ha sido expuesta al aire.
					
					La compania informo a todo el pais el estado de emergencia porque sobrepaso el limite la cantidad de radiactividad en el recinto de la central.
					
					Se confirmo que resultaron contaminados por la radiacion 2 japoneses que trabajaban en la central y 17 tripulantes de helicoptero del portaaviones norteamericano movilizados en las actividades de socorro.
					
					Las fuentes extranjeras transmiten que debido a la explosion sucesiva de reactores nucleares, la prefectura de Fukushima se va convirtiendo en la fantasmal.
					
					Quedaron cerrados los bancos, correos y otros edificios publicos y aumenta mas las tensiones la sirena que se escucha en todas partes.
					
					Numerosos ciudadanos horrorizados abandonan la ciudad.
					
					Se dice que los refugiados y camiones estan embotellados en la carretera a unos 50 km desde la central nuclear.
